name: Reggae
description: Developed in the 1960s; shuffling "bubble" and offbeat rhythms played on an organ, and staccato guitar and piano chords known as "skank."

children.name: Deejay
children.description: Reggae in which a deejay (similar to an MC in Hip Hop) talks or chants lyrics over a pre-recorded reggae rhythm.

children.name: Deejay
children.description: Reggae in which a deejay (similar to an MC in Hip Hop) talks or chants lyrics over a pre-recorded reggae rhythm.

children.name: Digital Dancehall
children.description: First, pre-Ragga style of Dancehall to popularize Electronic rhythms that arose in the mid-1980s.

children.name: Digital Dancehall
children.description: First, pre-Ragga style of Dancehall to popularize Electronic rhythms that arose in the mid-1980s.

children.name: Dub
children.description: Primarily instrumental Reggae which developed from the extensive use of studio techniques and effects like reverb and delay.

children.name: Dub
children.description: Primarily instrumental Reggae which developed from the extensive use of studio techniques and effects like reverb and delay.

children.name: Lovers Rock
children.description: Smooth, quiet Reggae beats with lyrics focusing on romance and love.

children.name: Lovers Rock
children.description: Smooth, quiet Reggae beats with lyrics focusing on romance and love.

children.name: Pacific Reggae
children.description: Developed in Pacific island communities, incorporating elements from local Oceanian Music styles.

children.name: Pacific Reggae
children.description: Developed in Pacific island communities, incorporating elements from local Oceanian Music styles.

children.name: Pop Reggae
children.description: Light, commercial form of Reggae designed to crossover and break through to a more mainstream Pop audience.

children.name: Pop Reggae
children.description: Light, commercial form of Reggae designed to crossover and break through to a more mainstream Pop audience.

children.name: Roots Reggae
children.description: Primarily defined through the political, spiritual, and socially conscious messages of its lyrics.

children.name: Roots Reggae
children.description: Primarily defined through the political, spiritual, and socially conscious messages of its lyrics.

children.name: Seggae
children.description: Fusion of Séga and Reggae, popular on Mauritius and other Mascarene Islands.

children.name: Seggae
children.description: Fusion of Séga and Reggae, popular on Mauritius and other Mascarene Islands.

children.name: Skinhead Reggae
children.description: Early subgenre prominent from 1968 to 1971; known for its high tempos and driving rhythms compared with the more languid pace of most later styles.
